verbs.description: instantiate (third-person singular simple present instantiates, present participle instantiating, simple past and past participle instantiated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To represent (a concept, theme, or principle) by an instance. [from 20th c.]
examples: To see and test the result of one's CSS for any particular HTML element, one must instantiate that element in a document.

entries.meaning: (transitive, object-oriented programming) To create an object (an instance) of a specific class. [from 20th c.]
examples: To instantiate  a class, we call its constructor.
